To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information."},"getRoleMemberCount(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"isPoolSupported(address)":{"details":"checks if protection is supported for the given pool only standard pools are supported (2 reserves, 50%/50% weights) note that the pool should still be whitelisted","params":{"poolAnchor":"anchor of the pool"},"returns":{"_0":"true if the pool is supported, false otherwise"}},"isPoolWhitelisted(address)":{"details":"checks whether a given pool is whitelisted","params":{"poolAnchor":"pool anchor"},"returns":{"_0":"true if the given pool is whitelisted, false otherwise"}},"lockDuration()":{"details":"returns the number of seconds from liquidation to full network token release","returns":{"_0":"the number of seconds from liquidation to full network token release"}},"maxProtectionDelay()":{"details":"returns the maximum number of seconds until full protection is in effect","returns":{"_0":"the maximum number of seconds until full protection is in effect"}},"minNetworkCompensation()":{"details":"returns the minimum amount of network tokens that the system can mint as compensation for base token losses","returns":{"_0":"the minimum amount of network tokens that the system can mint as compensation for base token losses"}},"minNetworkTokenLiquidityForMinting()":{"details":"returns the minimum network token liquidity for minting","returns":{"_0":"the minimum network token liquidity for minting"}},"minProtectionDelay()":{"details":"returns the minimum number of seconds until any protection is in effect","returns":{"_0":"the minimum number of seconds until any protection is in effect"}},"networkToken()":{"details":"returns the network token","returns":{"_0":"the network token"}},"networkTokenMintingLimits(address)":{"details":"returns the network token minting limit for a whitelist"}},"removePoolFromWhitelist(address)":{"details":"removes a pool from the whitelist can only be called by the contract owner","params":{"poolAnchor":"pool anchor"}},"removeSubscriber(address)":{"details":"removes a subscriber can only be called by the contract owner","params":{"subscriber":"subscriber address"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`."},"restoreRegistry()":{"details":"restores the previous contract-registry"},"restrictRegistryUpdate(bool)":{"details":"restricts the permission to update the contract-registry","params":{"_onlyOwnerCanUpdateRegistry":"indicates whether or not permission is restricted to owner only"}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. attributes.text:
@dev returns whether the provided reserve token is the network token
 @return whether the provided reserve token is the network token

AddLiquidityDisabled(address,address,boo.details: triggered when adding liquidity is disabled or enabled for a given reserve on a given pool

AverageRateMaxDeviationUpdated(uint32,ui.details: triggered when the maximum deviation of the average rate from the spot rate is updated

params.newAverageRateMaxDeviation: new maximum deviation of the average rate from the spot rate
params.prevAverageRateMaxDeviation: previous maximum deviation of the average rate from the spot rate

DefaultNetworkTokenMintingLimitUpdated(u.details: triggered when the default network token minting limit is updated

params.newDefault: new default network token minting limit
params.prevDefault: previous default network token minting limit

LockDurationUpdated(uint256,uint256).details: triggered when the network token lock duration is updated

params.newLockDuration: new network token lock duration, in seconds
params.prevLockDuration: previous network token lock duration, in seconds

MinNetworkCompensationUpdated(uint256,ui.details: triggered when the minimum network token compensation is updated

MinNetworkTokenLiquidityForMintingUpdate.details: triggered when the minimum amount of network token liquidity to allow minting is updated

params.newMin: new minimum amount of network token liquidity for minting
params.prevMin: previous minimum amount of network token liquidity for minting

NetworkTokenMintingLimitUpdated(address,.details: triggered when a pool network token minting limit is updated

PoolWhitelistUpdated(address,bool).details: triggered when the pool whitelist is updated

params.added: true if the pool was added to the whitelist, false if it was removed

ProtectionDelaysUpdated(uint256,uint256,.details: triggered when the protection delays are updated

params.newMinProtectionDelay: new seconds until the protection starts
params.prevMinProtectionDelay: previous seconds until the protection starts

SubscriberUpdated(address,bool).details: triggered when a subscriber is added or removed

params.added: true if the subscriber was added, false if it was removed

acceptOwnership().details: used by a new owner to accept an ownership transfer

addLiquidityDisabled(address,address).details: returns the permission of adding liquidity for a given reserve on a given pool

returns._0: true if adding liquidity is disabled, false otherwise

addPoolToWhitelist(address).details: adds a pool to the whitelist can only be called by the contract owner

addSubscriber(address).details: adds a subscriber can only be called by the contract owner

averageRateMaxDeviation().details: returns the maximum deviation of the average rate from the spot rate

returns._0: the maximum deviation of the average rate from the spot rate

defaultNetworkTokenMintingLimit().details: returns the default network token minting limit

returns._0: the default network token minting limit

disableAddLiquidity(address,address,bool.details: disables or enables adding liquidity for a given reserve on a given pool can only be called by the contract owner

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

isPoolSupported(address).details: checks if protection is supported for the given pool only standard pools are supported (2 reserves, 50%/50% weights) note that the pool should still be whitelisted

returns._0: true if the pool is supported, false otherwise

isPoolWhitelisted(address).details: checks whether a given pool is whitelisted

returns._0: true if the given pool is whitelisted, false otherwise

lockDuration().details: returns the number of seconds from liquidation to full network token release

returns._0: the number of seconds from liquidation to full network token release

maxProtectionDelay().details: returns the maximum number of seconds until full protection is in effect

returns._0: the maximum number of seconds until full protection is in effect

minNetworkCompensation().details: returns the minimum amount of network tokens that the system can mint as compensation for base token losses

returns._0: the minimum amount of network tokens that the system can mint as compensation for base token losses

minNetworkTokenLiquidityForMinting().details: returns the minimum network token liquidity for minting

returns._0: the minimum network token liquidity for minting

minProtectionDelay().details: returns the minimum number of seconds until any protection is in effect

returns._0: the minimum number of seconds until any protection is in effect

networkTokenMintingLimits(address).details: returns the network token minting limit for a given pool

returns._0: the network token minting limit for a given pool

removePoolFromWhitelist(address).details: removes a pool from the whitelist can only be called by the contract owner

removeSubscriber(address).details: removes a subscriber can only be called by the contract owner

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

restrictRegistryUpdate(bool).details: restricts the permission to update the contract-registry

params._onlyOwnerCanUpdateRegistry: indicates whether or not permission is restricted to owner only

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

setAverageRateMaxDeviation(uint32).details: sets the maximum deviation of the average rate from the spot rate can only be called by the contract owner

params.deviation: maximum deviation of the average rate from the spot rate

setDefaultNetworkTokenMintingLimit(uint2.details: updates the default amount of network token that the system can mint into each pool can only be called by the contract owner

params.amount: the default amount of network token that the system can mint into each pool

setLockDuration(uint256).details: updates the network token lock duration can only be called by the contract owner

params.duration: network token lock duration, in seconds

setMinNetworkCompensation(uint256).details: updates the minimum amount of network token compensation can only be called by the contract owner

params.amount: the minimum amount of network token compensation

setMinNetworkTokenLiquidityForMinting(ui.details: updates the minimum amount of network token liquidity to allow minting can only be called by the contract owner

params.amount: the minimum amount of network token liquidity to allow minting

setNetworkTokenMintingLimit(address,uint.details: updates the amount of network tokens that the system can mint into a specific pool can only be called by the contract owner

params.amount: the amount of network tokens that the system can mint into a specific pool

setProtectionDelays(uint256,uint256).details: updates the protection delays can only be called by the contract owner

transferOwnership(address).details: allows transferring the contract ownership the new owner still needs to accept the transfer can only be called by the contract owner
